I ordered the pancakes which were whole wheat and delicious with a half order of a skillet that had chicken bacon and avocado and tomatoes.  Delicious!!  I also ordered a boiled egg and it was great too!!

I had never been to an US Egg restaurant before, but you better believe I will be back - especially to this location if I can help it! Nicole waited on me and even gave me a pitcher to refill my soda. She was attentive and kind. She was also great at upselling/suggesting without being pushy. She got me to get a mimosa when I originally ordered a Diet Coke as well as two others in a booth nearby. Yum! She personally connected with the customer in the booth behind me as he seemed like a regular.  She was also knowledgeable about gluten free options for a guest. The food was excellent! I will definitely be getting a spinach/mushroom omelette again! Finally, the whole staff was welcoming. Next time I want to get a waffle for sure!
Best breakfast I've had in a long, long time.  The Hawkeye w jalapeo was great.  We had a party of 6 with a lot of modifications and the server nailed it.  We need one of these in LA!

We are from out of town and found US egg on instagram. The pictures lived up to the expectation of the food. I had a skillet and my mom had the French toast. My skillet was awesome and my moms French toast was pretty good. She got the basic French toast. It wasn't anything amazing but still good and hit the spot. Staff was also very friendly and helpful. We would defiantly recommend and would go back!

Excellent food, best coffee ever & great service. We where looking for somewhere to eat, and saw an advertisement sign spinner standing on the corner, turned around and went back. It was worth every bit. Looks small from the outside, but a lot of room inside.

Stopped by here with my girlfriend before driving out to LA. The protein pancakes were delicious, and the eatery had a nice homely vibe to it. However, the huge depiction of the United States on one of their walls is a cheap simplification at best..

I don't know why this place have 4 stars but I guess some people like their eggs, bread and pancakes served lukewarm...  For me, this place is best at 3 stars just to be nice.   I'm sorry for all those U.S egg fans out there but I take my breakfast seriously. My breakfast better be hot or you will get a very grump attitude from me! I thought hot breakfast should be a no brainer?? Unfortunately, I guess I have to request it to be hot and fresh out of the pan and not to expect that a place that serve solidly on breakfast should know any better. Oh I am sorry you don't serve solidly on breakfast?? Then you probably should take the word eggs out because you don't take your eggs seriously! Serve it hot or don't serve it at all!!!

We went here based on the Yelp reviews......they were on the money.....very good breakfast menu....service was good and the atmosphere was very bright. .....our omlettes were made of fresh ingredients and the side of fruit was excellent. ....great spot for breakfadt.
Our family had a delightful brunch at U.S. Egg.  The wait was short and the service great.  We all loved our meals, especially the unusually delicious pancakes.

The Big Jim's omelette has made this location of the chain up to five stars. The omelette only has white meat chicken , cheese and mushrooms inside, but it was that Big Jim mushroom sauce that gets poured over the top that took this dish literally over the top. It was creamy and dreamy and a great suggestion by the purple tinted hair very nice waitress. Just a good flavor in every bite. The solid hash browns and English Muffin rounded out at nice breakfast at about $12. Protein pancakes also still getting good reviews.  The only issue here is that they use a Wheat batter for pancakes and waffles. They need to find some buttermilk and then it could crack the Big 5 in Scottsdale.

perfect breakfast spot with quality ingredients and reasonable prices.  definitely enjoy my brunches here with my family.  service is fast and efficient and wait time is usually 20 minutes on busy mornings. will definitely return!

LOVE! I brought my niece in while her mommy got an hour to herself for a haircut and everyone was so accommodating! The food was really delicious and I felt like the value for it all was on point. I also got my own pot of coffee (which I needed, thankyouverymuch!) above all, my niece was happy and ate all of her breakfast
Great food.  Great service.  Highly recommend this place for breakfast.  They are family owned so if you come often, you feel a sense of belonging.  Thanks for the great food and service!

Delicious breakfast for a very reasonable price. Huge portions and great service. I really can't ask for more when it comes to reliable spots for a brunch. We took some visiting family and we were all really happy with what we ordered - yay!  My recommendation is the half and half with protein pancakes - I crave those pancakes regularly! And I would say prepare to wait a bit on weekends.

Absolutely fantastic food and service, I wish I could remember the sweetheart who served us, I think it was McCall or something unique of that sort? She deserves a raise !!! I got the meat lovers skillet, with the suggestion of our server, and I just about cried with satisfaction, I truly wish I were exaggerating. Very cute, classic-American, atmosphere and I will absolutely be back for that dang skillet, it's huge and able to be saved for later. Thanks to you, my morning was one of the best yet!

Great service,  reasonably priced, and most importantly great food!  Large portions,  and the staff is constantly checking in,  filling your drinks,  and taking great care of you.  And not to mention walking distance to Scottsdale stadium.

2nd time I have been here, great breakfast restaurant !  Yummy  breakfast , fast friendly staff! The wait staff are pretty nice and usually  typical breakfast places have grumpy staff ( I don't blame them I'm not a morning person lol)  Staff seems to very well organized & restaurant is clean and happy!   I have had the same waitress both visits , she is very sweet & told me the protein pancakes were nothing to be afraid of! And she was right- very delicious!   Love they serve cocktails & beer!

Shoule be zero stars! So, we have been here a few times before and everything was totally fine. Today, I was there with my family and we were in the back by the patio, and on the patio there is a bird flopping around, bleeding, obviously hurt...all 6 of us AND the table next to us that had kids kept looking and worrying, we told the waitress 3 times to.tell someone (she did) and she told some guy eho worked there and thought the bird was dead...we kept waiting for them to put a box on top or save it...anything...but instead  they called their property management company and they said they'd be out in a while to take care of it...BUT WE WERE EATING and my kids and the tables next to us had kids that were all sad and hiding their faces...still nothing happened we were watching the bird. So my father started calling around for vets...we were about 500 feet away from an emergency vet, so he got a box and scooped the bird in to the 'to go box' he was given, and him and I ran the still alive, flopping, bloody bird down the street  to the vet. When we came back, the table next to us thanked us. Then our food was cold, I tried to eat, but my patty melt was basically an old leather shoe even though I asked for med rare...my father lost his appetite and said he didn't want his food, but he would pay for it...but then the manager SARAH came over and asked 'if there was a problem'...i told her the story and my father interrupted me and just said 'don't worry i will still pay for my food' and she rudely said OH OK and walked away...not one person thanked my father except for THEIR CUSTOMERS!!!!!! So I decide I'm going to go talk to someone...i feel my food was so crappy and my father was treated rude...but of course SARAH was in charge and agreed to speak to me, and I told her CALMLY, I feel like you guys could have comped my fathers meal, he took away a dying bloody bird that bothered us and the people next to us...and she gets loud and says 'I didn't know but I couldn't have moved you anyway because we were full! We called property management what else could we do!?!?!' And I said 'our waitress was awesome but I think with my horrible patty melt, and us watching that bird flop around about 6 feet away from us, you could have been kinder and more accomodating...' and while I'm talking she rolls her eyes and starts to look away and smirk...and I lost it...i told her 'since you want to act like this, I'm going to tell the school apt, my Scottsdale mommy blog and everyone I know at the schools down the street that you treated us badly, let dying rodents stay, and rolled your eyes and looked away while I'm trying to talk to you and that I've never been treated so shitty at a restaurant in my life'...and she slams her towel and gets up and says 'if you're cussing at me I'm walking away'....and she walked away! Some guy who was leaving with his family was laughing when I walked by and said 'I can't believe she walked away from you after all that"...i said 'no kidding!!!' I guess he heard us. I will never come back and I will tell everyone at the 3 local schools I am involved in what happened! I am so disappointed and disgusted!!!!!!

I'm not typically a breakfast kind of guy, but occasionally I get a craving for breakfast foods. Whenever I get this craving, U.S. Egg is my go-to place. The half-and-half breakfast is the best of both worlds, you get a great egg and potato skillet plus their awesome protein pancakes.

Once again in town for medical appointments and stopped by for breakfast and lunch on consecutive days. The food was great, I especially like their grits at breakfast, but the egg dishes are really the best. Once again we had the pleasure of Bailey as our server, she is special, outstanding and prompt service, thank you.

Seriously, Spring Training would be nothing without US Egg. Located just a few blocks from Scottsdale Stadium (Home of the two time San Francisco Giants.. ahem), this place is a must-go before an afternoon game.   Why is US Egg so special? Well, even though there is a wait, you get FREE coffee? There is a private parking lot so no need to stress about parking either.   The food is awesome. Try the half and half - two protein pancakes (delish pancakes with slivers of almonds, oatmeal, and blueberries - SUPER FOODS!), and a skillet of your choosing. Skillets can come with bacon, chorizo, peppers, onions, you name it. And they are topped with a fried egg. Yes, yes, a thousand times yes.   Service is excellent and fast. Water is in a pitcher on your table so you don't have to wait for refills. As is coffee.  What else do you need?

The food and service were outstanding. The omelettes and skillet dishes were the best that we ever experienced. The pricing is good. There were lots of people. There was a 20 minute wait in a breakfast line. Obviously, other people have the same opinion about U.S. Egg, otherwise why would so many people wait in a breakfast line. We will gladly wait in that line again to repeat our good experience with that restaurant.

This place is just alright.  Prior to my sister's graduation, we stopped at US Egg, so my sister can grab breakfast with her classmates. When we were seated, there was still a pitcher of water, from the previous party, along with some trash that sat there for a good 10 minutes, before someone cleaned it off.  Not long after the table was cleaned off, our waitress quickly got our drinks and food ordered. But, when the food was delivered, the main server directed the other server to put a plate of food in front of mom, but she gives it to my dad instead and just walked away, leaving our poor waitress to make the switch.  Food portions are huge, so well worth your bang for your buck. I loved my cornbeef and hash dish. Unfortunately, a few of the staff's customer service skills could use some improvement.

Love this place.  Family owned since 1991 it says on the menu, and a nice clean place with some outdoor seating too.  Almost too clean, but I guess it's better to be that way than too dirty.  I had the Texas Omlette with Chili that was a good option.  Add a bit of Tabasco for kick and it's perfect.  Sitting outside under the deck and read the New York Times - was not rushed, but service was also attentive.  Good local joint for breakfast!

Great breakfast.  My friends got protein pancakes, I got biscuits and gravy.  Both were excellent.  A little pricey for breakfast, but way better than the Denny's across the street.   Highly recommend!

Stopped in for breakfast since I was having a tire fixed next door. They did not disappoint!! The coffee was great and they even leave a carafe at your table so you never have to wait for a refill. I had the half and half with protein pancakes. It was so good!! Pancakes were loaded with blueberries. Server was friendly and attentive.
Protein Pancakes are Incredible. This is a multi location family owned restaurant that always treats us great. The food is consistently delicious. No matter what you order you really cant go wrong.

Love this place its perfect for breakfast and I gotta say the service was extraordinary.  I mean the waitresses all had smiles and came across like they really cared about the customers here.  Now this is a place I'll definitely come back to when I'm on this side of town.

Everytime I come here to eat on the way to work it's always a good experience.  I'd say one step above dennys.  Servers are fast and attentive.  Just what I need when I'm on the go. ..)))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))

One of many good breakfast/brunch options in the Scottsdale area.  We were a group of 9 including children.  We were seated promptly and the waitress was patient with all the chaos associated with hungry young kids.  Coffee was served quickly and was above average; as were the juices.  Food arrived promptly.  The omelettes I sampled in our group were all flavorful and the pancakes were delicious.  Overall a good experience for hungry people.  Highly recommend a visit if you are in the mood for this type of food.

This is my go-to breakfast spot!  We've never had to wait for a table, which is definitely nice when you're looking for your first meal of the day.  The menu is large and includes both breakfast and lunch items.  I love that if you order water or iced tea, they bring a pitcher to your table.  The service has always been friendly and despite how large of a restaurant it is, we have never had to wait a long time for our food to come out.
Fast seating for large parties.  They now serve GLUTEN FREE waffles and French toast! Yummy!!  Bacon is awesome too

Solid 4 stars every time!   The Protein pancakes are a favorite for a good reason.   They're great and filling with the right kind of ingredients.   I recommend the 1/2 and 1/2 which is two good sized protein pancakes with 1/2 a skillet variety and one egg.  Their iced tea is decent and we've always had service that was at least better than average.   Easy to find and reasonable prices.   Winner!  (Now why they are listed under 'Burgers' instead of breakfast, well who knows.)
This place gets your order out faster than any breakfast restaurant I've ever been to. Awesome food, big portions, plenty of seating, very friendly all-female waitstaff.

This place has the best breakfast/brunch by far! Closes at 2:30 so get there early because the place fills up quickly and there is a steady stream of folks waiting to partake in a great meal. Indoor and outdoor seating. Waitstaff can be more attentive, but the place is always super busy! I tried a skillet...ham, sausage, mushrooms, bacon, and tomatoes on a bed of hash rounds then covered with cheese! DELICI'! All the food and beverages came very promptly to the table.

I thought my meal was OK. I ordered an omelette and had a cup of coffee. I thought it was a little pricey for the quality of food I had got. It seems kind of chain-ish. It seems to be quantity over quality here. You can get a much better breakfast across the street in my opinion.

This was my second time eating here and both times I ate here it was during the weekend.   The place has been busy both times I was here. Inside is very bland and boring, I guess you could say it looks generic. We were seated fairly quickly given the 10 minute wait. Upon sitting down we noticed our glasses were dirty, this was the case the first time we ate here as well. Our sever was at our table to take our drink orders right away and she brought us clean glasses. The menu selection is big. The food quality is no better than Denny's and for more money. I love huevos rancheros and what they have here is not huevos rancheros, they use flour tortillas with the dish and it is overall bland. Same goes for the other dishes that my friends had, just bland. All the food came out luke warm but very fast. My friends over easy eggs were cooked thru. When my food came out I was given an English muffin with mold on it. The server immediately took the muffin away and brought another which was nice but received no apology from the manager. I wonder how many people ate muffins with mold on them.   Anyway, in a nutshell this place has questionable food quality and bland food to match the bland interior. But the service is quick and nice with easy parking.

Got management response. No...not my job to tell a young server the food was not prepared adequately...not his job...send something back to kitchen...take your chances. Food came out as these folks are trained. Management issue.

We rode here from Washington state for bike week and this is the best place we have been for breakfast by far. Our server Brittani has been great. Very fast and friendly. My wife had the half and half with the Santa Fe it was great. I had the club and it was also really good. I would recommend this place to anyone.

This was our first visit to US Egg and we were told that it is busy but worth the wait.  Well it was true...we waited about 25 minutes for our table (not bad for a Sunday morning).  The food was worth the wait....very fresh and hot.  A couple of mix ups on the order but they were corrected very quickly and did not interfere with anyone have to watch while the rest of eat.  Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to have a good breakfast or lunch.  Only negative is that it is a little noisy if you are trying to carry on a conversation with someone several seats away.

US Egg has become my parent's and my favorite breakfast place on our annual pilgramage to Phoenix to visit family. Our trip is not complete without at least one visit to this spot. The service is always great, as is the food. I am not usually a sweet breakfast person, but the Protein Pancakes are too good to pass up. I love that they offer the Half and Half, which includes a small order of the protein pancakes and a half skillet. Perfect for satisfying the sweet and salty cravings. The coffee is decent, which is all I ask for in a no frills breakfast spot. There is a large parking lot at this location, although it can get a bit crowded at peak breakfast time. If you are looking for a good, hearty breakfast or lunch, check this place out, it won't disappoint.

I had the Cheese Chorizo Omelette, coffee, and a side of Sausage. The Omelette was excellent but the side of sausage was horrible, I'm pretty sure it was microwaveable Jimmy Dean Sausage Links, no joke! Also, it's roughly 7 dollars for coffee and the a side of sausage which is outrageous.   I'll skip on my next trip to Scottsdale.

Excellent breakfast.  Had the protein pancake which was wonderful. The syrup sat on top and the pancake did not act like a sponge. The hash browns were not greasy or fried. They were light and the shredded potatoes did not clump together  they were lightly salted and so delicious. The scrambled eggs were exactly how I ordered them. I would go back in a heart beat

My husband and I ate here while traveling to Scottsdale. I am a picky eater and very health conscious. I loved this restaurant. The food was fresh and well prepared. We had the skillets. I'm carb adverse so it was easy to just not eat the hash browns. The dish was very well prepared. Great coffee. They gave us an entire pot and full pitcher of water too. The service was excellent from the time we were greeted at the door. We will be back.
Great place never disappoints , music ,people , like being at home for breakfast !!!!!!!
Terrific service, Skylar! Excellent protein waffle & poached eggs! I'll be back from Sedona soon!  Keep up the great service!!!

I had the half and half so I can get the famous protein pancakes. My girlfriend had the Turkey sausage with scramble eggs and English muffin.  the protein pancakes were delcious. The service was fast, I must say they do very well with handling crowd getting people seated.

All four items our family ordered were sub par. If your name is US Egg, you better know how to cook eggs. My omelet was an under seasoned scrambled egg folded over poorly cooked and under seasoned veggies ( they also shouldn't be wet). The salsa I asked to pour over my omelet was also bland so that didn't help.   The up-charged fruit that came with my dish was lukewarm and over ripe making it very bitter. Ew.   My husbands "poached" egg was over cooked making it hard as a rock. His $10 skillet was bland with under seasoned veggies, dry-as-a-bone chicken, and under cooked potatoes.   My kids' pancakes were way dry. They only picked the apples out and left the pancake.   Overall, we were way disappointed. I guess short shorts and beer Doesn't make for a good breakfast.

What a waste of money. You would think that a restaurant with Egg in its name could prepare eggs. Well i guess not. My over easy eggs came with a hard yolk and rubbery whites. My grits were hard and only warm. The chicken sausage was luke warm. The raisin toast was good, that's why they got a star. My wife ordered eggs Benedict. She also received hard boiled eggs and very little hollandaise sauce. I guess we need to find a better breakfast spot.

I love breakfast. The food here is really good; I just wish the service lived up to how good the food was. Our waitress never told us her name and was nonexistent throughout the meal. I also ordered a side of sourdough toast and never received it. I ordered the eggs benedict, like always, and I wasn't disappointed. My friend ordered a blueberry muffin that was by far one of the best muffins I've ever had. My other friend wanted to substitute something for eggs in her meal and the waitress refused to work with her and basically just told her she couldn't. The least she could have done was ask a manager first. I'd eat here again just because the food was good, but I'd hope the service was better next time.
Protein pancakes for the win. Nothing better after hiking Camelback.   Would recommend to anyone looking for a solid breakfast joint.

Food was best breakfast we have had - Half and Half with Protein Pancakes and omelet is best thing on menu!   Service was eggcellent!  We wanted to go back the next day to have another breakfast there before we left town.

Maybe I'm not a fan of diner food.   Service was very friendly on a busy Sunday morning. Restaurant was huge, but the decor was a bit tacky. We had the Cali Eggs Benedict, protein pancakes, waffles, and a veggie skillet. After a night of debauchery, we needed some serious comfort food.  The portions are huge but everything was mediocre and forgettable.   Perfect example of why there is a portion control issue in our country.  I did like 1 thing, the double carafe coffee on the table so we can help ourselves with coffee refills.

This location needs to take a lesson from the I-17 and bell location.   We frequently eat at US egg so when work brought us to this side of town we decided to eat here.   The menu and the decor are the same but that is where the similarity ends.   The pancakes were tiny and my omelette was much smaller which seems impossible since it's a three egg omelette.  I get the same thing every time I go so was surprised the bill was higher; apparently at this location i get charged extra for my egg whites.  The english muffin was burnt and my avacado was bad (see picture).  Sadly a bad experience at a chain that is usually amazing.

Good service, good food, inexpensive and typical American breakfast fare.  Come here if you want fast service with a smile and predictable food.  I had the omelette with green chili.  I can't complain about a thing other than I did send every glass and cup on the table back to the dishwasher because they were gross.  Ask for 'to go' cups for your coffee and OJ.

Top notch breakfast spot in old town Scottsdale. They literally have everything for everyone to enjoy. Perfect for families or if you just want to eat alone. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming and all the servers have smiles on their faces. Our server, Bailey was wonderful! Very attentive to our table and took great care of us. We will be back!
US Egg is a great spot for a quick delicious breakfast, or a brunch with friends! Always good food and service.

Solid three stars. Food was tasty and well portioned and cooked. Anything outstanding? No.   I loved the wild blueberry pancakes and eggs and hash browns were appropriately cooked.   The laughable part of our meal was the soda- it came in these tiny glasses.  I know! Most people get their caffeine through coffee. However those of us who do not, prefer glasses of it that are larger than a shot glass.   There is a fun, naughty and sardonic Americana vibe to this place. Friendly staff

This place is delicious.  Five of us went for breakfast after running the AZ Urban Race and it was exactly what we needed.  Huge menu and the food was great.  I heart breakfast food!  The prices are slightly pricey for a breakfast menu but nothing unreasonable.  Plus - you get a LOT of food.

Came here for breakfast before my flight to SFO and all the raving I've read on here is completely TRUE.  I got the Half & Half breakfast with the protein pancakes it comes with a scramble as well, more than enough food for two to share and cheap prices.  Loved the quick service and nice staff, I didn't have any problems with them like I read from some others so perhaps they resolved all the issues.  I would definitely recommend this place and visit again the next time I'm in the Scottsdale area.
Get takeout from here all the time for lunch. The portions are large and delicious. The staff is always so friendly and nice.

I really enjoyed my waffles with blueberries.  They said fresh blueberries but mine looked really small and dark (as if they had been defrosted).  Maybe I'm spoiled by the huge NJ blueberries.  Anyway, my waffles tasted fine with the berries (whatever they were).  The coffee was good too.

I went in for brunch this morning with my mom, and forgetting that every place would be slammed on a Saturday, we were having trouble finding a place that would not have a long wait. Fortunately, we went to this place last minute after calling ahead to ask for hold times to which I was replied with "no wait time".  We went in, and only had to wait for less than a minute for us to get a table in a full house. Our server, Ti, was EXCELLENT. She was very attentive, kind, and was super helpful when my mom accidentally spilled some ketchup on herself. We were very impressed with her service, that we gave her a handcrafted coap from our business that we run as a thank you.  I had the strawberry pancakes with over medium eggs and hashbrowns. She had the blueberry oatmeal with a side of eggs. It was so delicious, and It didn't make me feel super full and bloated that starched pancakes normally would. It's a huge benefit that they make whole wheat pancakes, with decent servings.   I like that they have the coffee pot and water pitcher readily available for you at the table. It takes pressure off the server and customer for when they want refills and how much of a serving they want.   The place was well lit, clean and the bathrooms were very clean too.   Overall, I had a great experience and would come back again!

We were in town visiting from California so I was VERY excited to try this place! It's so hard finding a decent breakfast place where we live so I love when other states have them!   We walked in and the place wasn't too big nor too small, the wait was about 10 mins and they moved quickly to get every seated. Host and servers were very nice, efficient and helpful with the menu.   I loved the fact that they have a big and delicious gluten free menu! There was so many choices and options to accommodate food intolerances and allergies rather than the typical bland food most restaurants do, I could tell these people really took their time to make the menu right for everyone!   Upon bringing us our drinks they brought us a pitcher of whatever we ordered so we never went without a beverage... California... learn something from them!! I LOVED that seeing I drink a lot when I eat!   Food came out very quickly and hot! You can tell it wasn't sitting at the window for a long time. I ordered the gluten free veggie scramble with gluten free toast and hollandaise sauce. Food was delicious and a big portion!   Pricing was decent and normal and service was good. Good food and good service? A definite go to again when I visit.
Good food, good serves BUT the sign guy on the corner was the BEST part! Keep up the energetic work!

U.S Egg is a lovely breakfast establishment here in Scottsdale. The atmosphere is fresh, clean and quite a bit more spacious than other dining establishments. Indoor and outdoor seating is available to suit your preference and the weather, and the interior has refreshingly simple and calming decor.  The menu has options for breakfast and lunch (could even be eaten for dinner), and has options not unlike a typical breakfast joint for the exception of their delicious protein pancakes stuffed with yummy granola, blueberries, almond slivers, and cinnamon! U.S Egg has several combo options so you can make the most variety out of your meal, not to mention many healthy options and alternatives if you have any dietary needs or restrictions.  My server was quite pleasant and the overall vibe of the restaurant was very enjoyable. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to breakfast or brunch at a lovely place.

Thoroughly enjoyable for breakfast/brunch.  Excellent service.  Huge portions.  Food clearly cooked to order. Great hash browns- no sogginess there.  Outdoor space is quiet And, love that they provide carafes/pitchers of beverages on the table so you don't have to be constantly asking for refills.

Doesn't disappoint. Food is always consistent and service is pretty quick, even when it's completely packed. Servers are always cheerful and full of energy. Good choice for a weekend breakfast/brunch.

Boom Susan!!! This place is solid. Ordered up 2 poached eggs extra crispy bacon, hash browns and toast. Everything was cooked perfect and the service was on point. Only complaint is that it's a little pricey but then again you get what you pay for.
We like to support local businesses liek U S EGG. Great dependable food at reasonable prices. The pancakes are always a treat.

My family and I ate breakfast here on a Sunday morning while on vacation. There are a ton of options. I had the Hawkeye omolette. It was very good. My wife had poached eggs, bacon and pancakes. My daughters each had a nice sized kids breakfast for $5. The portions are generous and the prices were what you would expect for a decent breakfast. The service was excellent. I would definitely come back here.

If you want a delicious, down home breakfast, then US Egg is the place for you. Don't expect to leave the place hungry...read on....  We had breakfast at US Egg before leaving town after a getaway night in Scottsdale. The interior is clean, the staff is very friendly, and the environment is bright, the signs are quirky, and it's a rather fun place. I ordered the South Omelette with chorizo, cheese, onions, and other veggies. It was huuuuuuuuuuuge and came with hash browns and an English muffin. The breakfast was larger than the breakfast I typically eat at home, but I snarfed this down with no problems or guilt. When something is this good, who can count calories, eh? US Egg also caters to gluten-sensitive and the requirements of gluten-free meals for customers. They have a fairly extensive gluten-free menu and they even made a fresh gluten-free hollandaise sauce for my wife and her omelette.  Also, the staff were very friendly and the vibe of US Egg is very much like a neighborhood restaurant where everyone knows your name and you always look forward to going there.   Overall, if you love breakfast and are in Scottsdale, I highly recommend US Egg. It's just good down home comfort breakfast food. Yum!
Had breakfast here yesterday and our waitress was just as pleasant as the first.  Outstanding  customer service, great food, good times
it is true that the protein pancakes here are good, but overall this is just an average, "big box" place for brunch.  nothing bad, just nothing especially good about it either.

I LOVE this place!!! I'm so happy they opened this location since it's closer to my house! Both locations on Osborn and Shea never disappoint! Always excellent food and excellent service. We come here all the time and I'm in love with their coffee and skillets.   Today was my Birthday and of course wanted to go to my ALL time FAVORITE breakfast spot, US EGG. Our server was wonderful, I think her last/first name was Galloway?  I told her it was my birthday so I was gonna order a mimosa with my coffee. I also decided to order something different today. I ordered off the secret menu and got their jalapeo scramble! So delicious and I loved the fresh jalapeos! It wasn't very spicy which was nice!!! Towards the end of the meal she brought me out a complimentary protein pancake for my Birthday! So amazing! I was so shocked and happy!   I truly am in love with this place! The best service I've ever had truly. I will continue to be a word of mouth for this establishment! Thank you always for the wonderful service and food!
Protein pancakes were the best pancakes I've ever had. Went with the half and half and combined them with the veggie skillet. Great service and restaurant.

Chicken fried steak is up there with the best of em!!! Service has always been great, smiling faces early in the morning is great to see. The food comes out quickly, and the prices are always good. It's definitely a go-to when we're hungry for good food.

This was the first time I've been to this location.  This one has been newly renovated and everything looks clean, pretty, and nice.  I usually get two eggs hashbrowns and toast but this time I wanted to try something different.  The amount of food you get for the price is amazing.  That's why I love coming here well and because I like the hashbrowns too.  But I always have leftovers to last me another meal or two.  I got some type of omelet which was really good.  Service was great as usual.
Coffee was terrible. Can't do eggs as ordered? Its an egg place, says so in the name! I would not go back, not with so many other options in the area.
Great establishment for breakfast or lunch.  Well managed with efficient and attentive wait staff.  Great egg dishes.  The Texas Omelet is beyond "delish"!!!

So the two year anniversary coupon came in the mail.  We had to figure out our training schedule that would allow for us to grab a breakfast before work.  I have to tell you, what's stopping me from trying more items on the menu is clearly the fact that the protein pancakes are the bombdotcom.  Service was pretty solid and I was able to leave with a hot cup of coffee to go.  Will be back when I'm craving those pancakes again.

Wow. This is the best breakfast pre-race, post-race and remembering I used to race place! We were in town for that Ironman and ate here no less than 3 times in about 5 days. Delicious and hearty breakfasts. The servers were all really fast and friendly and i even saw one of them volunteering on race day! I think my husband would consider this the best pancake he's put in his mouth. I think they were called Power Pancakes or something.  The eggs/omelets are also very tasty. The only downfall I see is that we don't have this place at home.

This place should be 4 1/2 stars.  Service very fast but sincere and patient.  The protein pancakes are as good of a pancake as there is.  It's a cakier pancake with blueberries and granola on wheat flour.  You can order the pancakes only, or you can upgrade your eggs and pancake special to include the protein pancake.   The eggs are perfectly cooked.  It's convenient to get to and it put a big smile on my face as even during lunch hours, it, thank god, serves breakfast.  The interior is a tan colored minimalist look but with an American theme that has this interesting blown up map of the United States.  Bathrooms are clean also.  The only thing that prevents this place from being five stars is that  the coffee isn't eye opening.  If they serve Starbucks Coffee or something stronger or comparable, there will be no better breakfast place than it.  But in this part of the US, the good American Breakfast joint is ubiquitous.

U.S. Egg is a great place for breakfast and the protein cake is notable.  The other dishes are good, too, but the protein cake can only be gotten at this restaurant (as far as I know).  It is just delicious!  Another thing to know about U.S. Egg - there is often a line outside the door but do not let that dissuade you - it moves quickly and you won't wait long.  And of course, it's worth it!  Plenty of parking, too.

This is my favorite breakfast place and I'm happy that there is now a location on Shea Boulevard.    On Sundays, of course, there is a line but what I have always noticed about US Egg is that the line moves.  Plus, this place is large.  Last Sunday, we waited maybe 10 minutes - well worth it.  We come here for the protein cake because it is unique and delicious.  The other breakfast items are good; I have never had a bad meal at US Egg.  Food is quite plentiful, too, and you might end up taking some home.  You get a pitcher of water at your table and if you order coffee, you get a pitcher at your table.  That's so convenient.  There are so many great breakfast places in Scottsdale and this is definitely one of them.

I would've given this place a higher review but I just couldn't.   I was seated right away which was nice. My waitress was great. Everything was fine until I received my order. I had the protein pancakes that I've read so much about in the other reviews and they were really good. Problem was that as I was cutting into the pancake it was raw. I couldn't grab the attention of my waitress so I waved over another girl. I told her that it wasn't cooked all the way and asked if I could have another. She apologized and took my plate away. Before she left she turned to me and said "So you want them cooked well done?". I almost laughed but I saw that she was dead serious. With as straight of a face as possible I said "yes please." What I wanted to say was that I wasn't aware that pancakes came any other way, but I don't think that would've gone over so well.   I would go back again but I would make sure to cut into the middle of the pancake first!

Came here at 8:00 this morning with my son looking for a good hot breakfast experience. The restaurant was 1/3 full.  I ordered the chicken mushroom omelet with mushroom cream sauce, hash browns and an English Muffin. It arrived barely warm and upon complaining was brought a side of sauce.  I will not return...my omelet obviously.was either not fresh made or sat in the kitchen too long. Even the muffin had need pre toasted and served as if an afterthought. Hash browns were blah. Mashed inferior...barely crisped at all. My son had eggs over easy with a tiny grilled chicken breast and a side of spinach. Couldn't eat the unseasoned, lukewarm spinach, but his eggs and grill marked chicken were adequately hot. He commented that we might have faired better at Dennys...though we both avoid that alternative. If your looking for a good traditional breakfast, I'd recommend you avoid US Egg. I paid $27. 99 minus tip...water to drink which would be ok if food was hot and better prepared...it was not! Right now turned off of getting a breakfast experience for a while!  Wait staff barely made it to our table to leave bill...let alone ask how the food was.

What a rip off. If I had seen the Einstein's on the opposite corner before placing my to go order over the phone, I would have gone there. But being from out of town, I was at their mercy. I ordered a bacon egg and cheese bagel. It was for my son. He said it tasted like ass. To add insult to injury, it cost $10.50. I could've gotten the same at Einstein's for four dollars

I'm not a huge pancake fan.  They have to be really good for me to eat them.  Today, I found a pancake I love!  The protein pancakes are great!  All U.S. Egg's pancakes are made with whole wheat but the protein pancakes also pack in granola and almond slivers.  It sounds too grainy but it's not.  They are SO wonderful.    I also love that they bring you a pitcher of iced water and a carafe of coffee.  I hate when waitresses refill my coffee to soon and mess up my "blend" of cream and sugar.  I also hate when I can't get anyone to fill my cup.  So, this was a nice perk (ha, pun intended).    This place has a great variety at reasonable prices.  I'll definitely come back here the next time I visit Scottsdale.

I want in on owning this US Egg in Scottsdale.  The volume they crank out is incredible.  We had a short wait then into the packed rest. and off to the races.  Nice that they give you a pot of coffee at the table so you can pour away.  I had the huevos rancheros-quite good- and my friends had a split meal with a small skillet and two pancakes.  We had just summitted Camelback Mountain so the food hit the spot.   The kitchen fired up the food quickly and service was quick as we needed to get going to a spring training game it all was perfecto!  Yes-how do I get a piece of the action?

I love love love US Egg! Everything is delicious and the service is really quick most of the time. The Idaho skillets are amazing and the protein pancakes are a must-have. My friends and I call them "crack" pancakes because they are so addictive! My only complaint is that the mimosas have pulp in them, which I think is weird. But this is my absolute favorite breakfast place!
Us egg is a fantastic place to eat the people are great always great service and great food very  very clean and the management carmine is the best

Plenty of parking space made me love this place even more. I tried protein pancake like anybody else. It was great. Nice servers, they gave us a pot of coffee and jar of water so that we don't have to get their attention to get refill ... and they serve alcohols which I didn't know!! Next time my breakfast will be with Bloody Mary.

I loved the fact that this place has the option for protein powder in their pancakes! Also they were able to get us in despite the fact that they were packed on a Sunday. The staff was friendly and the service was good.
Tried the protein pancakes and was not disappointed. Highly recommend the half and half - half protein pancakes, half egg scramble.

It's just a breakfast not too fancy. Weak coffee.... the one thing I'd like to recommend for this restaurant and all restaurant is bring the bill. there's nothing worse than having to sit and wait and wait and wait for them to bring your bill so that you can get back on the road never asked if I wanted more coffee breakfast was luke warm.

I come to U.S. Egg as often as I can! I meet friends for breakfast here every once in a while, but mostly I come here alone to read, drink coffee and have breakfast! They treat me so well every time I come in! I always get amazing and consistent service and my go to breakfast meal (the Half & Half, half Protein Pancakes and half Idaho Hot Skillet) never disappoints! I love everything about this spot and highly recommend it! :)

Everything was bad. The service was TERRIBLE. I'm here for work so it was just me. The guy would not seat outside, but then right after he sat me at the first table next to the door I watched him seat a couple outside right away. My server was very nice at first and brought me a water and beverage. After she took my order, I never saw her again. Meanwhile, the Bloody Mary was so bad I had to dump so much hot sauce to even drink it. The only good thing was bacon. My food came fast but was awful. The hash browns are so mushy and disgusting they are almost watery. My eggs Benedict had literally one drop of hollandaise sauce. And it was terrible. The ham could not even be cut it was so bad. No one ever asked me how my food was once. My server never came back after taking my order. And don't call me "sweetie" to try to make up for it. Waste of time and money. WAAAAY overpriced.

Solid brunch place!  Good service, very clean, and inexpensive, to boot!   Even though I had a pretty plain item - pancakes, eggs, and potatoes, it was all very good.  Highly recommend the protein pancakes, which have oats and blueberries! They were super delicious, and had a nice, fluffy, texture.  Even though I was the only person who ordered ice tea, they brought a whole pitcher so I could refill at my every whim, which was often, because Arizona is friggin DRY and I wasn't used to it!  Minus one star because there's nothing extraordinary on the menu (no unique specials or anything), but everything was delciious.

Had family here for breakfast. Medium over eggs were all over cooked. The hash browns were soggy. 6 of us barely ate. Told waitress and was charged full price. Not happy with this place. Chef needs to know what over medium eggs are. And how hash browns should be cooked.

Breakfast here before a long drive from Scottsdale to Sacramento. Had the US Egg sandwich which was very good. Thick bacon and a lot of cheese. Very clean restaurant and restrooms. "Sam" our waitress was very good!

Huge fan of the Egg, I use to live next to the one on Baseline. Points for the waitress filling our coffee cup 3/4 full so we have room for cream. Negative points for giving us the check half way through our breakfast, I feel like your kicking us out.....I hate that.   The food is always great, I've never had a complaint the 100 times I've eaten at US Egg.

Everyone kept raving about how great this place is so I dragged a friend of mine out Sat am for breakfast with me. I've def had better. Food was ok but nothing special. The potatoes could have used to been cooked a bit longer so they were a little crispier. But honestly, same thing different place. Nothing really stood out as better to me than the next place.   I felt like the place was crowded too. The seating that is. Not just because of all the people in there. Ample parking, average prices, friendly staff.
This was the first time my Wife & I ate at this restaurant. The food was great, the staff was very friendly, and the environment was inviting. I highly recommend it.

The service is quick and friendly, exactly what you'd expect from a no-frills breakfast place. Funny thing about US Egg is I'm definitely a fan although I absolutely hate eggs.  During my last visit I was served by Erica, she was friendly and pleasant. My meal came out cooked perfectly and it was really good. I had corned beef and hash, with hash browns, bacon and sourdough toast. I rarely finish a big breakfast but I ate every bit of this. You really can't beat a classic restaurant place. No major complaints about this location, it's very lively and clean.   One thing I will say is a bummer is not being able to substitute for the eggs on the corned beef and hash meal, it increased my ticket $5 not being able to do that. Other than that it's good.

Took my buddy here the other day to nurse a hangover. Great food. Reasonably priced. Definitely did the job for us. They are open til 2pm serving breakfast. Friendly staff. They brought us pitchers of our drinks so we didn't have to chase a waitress down everytime we wanted a refill. I like that.
All good. Seated right away, ordered right away, food came out in a timely manner. Manager came up to table to greet us.

Just went today and had a good experience.  They leave the coffee pot on the table for you to refill as you desire.  Had blueberry pancakes and bacon, onion and pepper skillet.  Very good and not too heavy.  Coffee is good as well.  Server was very good as she was always around to make sure things were fine.

It's packing but you can still get in quickly which is a good thing if there are 6 of you and you are hungry.  Pretty standard fare but it is reasonably priced and they get it to the table pretty darn quick.  Will say they do make some significantly large enough pancakes.  I suggest the blueberry ones - YUM!  And they will keep the juices, water, and coffee coming as long as you want them.  Even though we like trying new places to eat when we travel we seem to gravitate to this place each time we are in Scottsdale.
Half and half was great. You get protein pancakes and choice of skillet. I had the chicken avocado skillet. Portion was just right. Both pancakes and skillet were great.

Pretty good breakfast and blazing fast service. Had quite a nice omelet this morning. I'd give 3.5 stars if I could but it wasn't quite up to 4 stars. Typical Az coffee ( which usually sucks) but a nice omelet and the fruit was fresh.

Very good service bumps this breakfast spot ahead of the new Paradise Bakery. The menu could use a refresh and I'd love to see some healthy omelettes. It seems every time I have come here, they are really friendly, and differentiate based on service.  Free wifi is a big plus! I have never tried the lunch as breakfast continues to be really great.

We went here from a suggestion from family. They are known for their protein pancakes and although I am not a big pancake fan I thought I should try them. They have what they call half half. This allows you to get a smaller portion of pancakes and their skillet of your choice. That was the perfect meal, I was able to try the pancakes and get the eggs, hash browns and fixings as well. The pancakes are really good and are definitely highly recommended. I really enjoyed them and of course my skillet was just as tasty. I got the bacon, onion and pepper skillet that comes mixed with hash browns and topped with an egg( cooked your way). We thoroughly enjoyed it and would definitely return. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Really good BASIC food. If you're a true "foodie" or looking for more of a trendy breakfast/brunch spot this is definitely not it. However it's good for kids and if you're in a hurry. Service was great, food came out very fast and portions were huge. Overall nothing spectacular.

Met Alice Cooper here once.  Eat the crunchy granola pancakes.  Do not get two, you only need one.  One is bigger than your head.  Coffee is bottomless.  Not the best coffee I've had, but good for an egg joint.  For Scottsdale it's not an uppity place..just what you need for breakfast.  Fast, in and out in about 15 minutes and under $15.

I have ate here many times, and had the chance to eat here again this past February. I went with the protein pancakes again. Still as good as I remember. The place wasn't as busy as I remember it was and they really need to do something about the fruit fly's, they were annoying. All in all, good food.

I have tried several locations and always get sub par food quality.  Temperature and Accuracy were off today.  I ordered the Triple play combo with protein pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon.  I got two plates of cold food and sausage instead of bacon.  I let the server know about the bacon before trying the food she applogised and said she would get me bacon.  When she returned she let me know she wrote down sausage and I said I ordered bacon and my food is cold.  Her tone changed a little after that and brought me some fresh fruit while I wait for meal to be re-cooked.  It was much better, but wow what a lousy start.  The prices are too high to eat just so so food and have servers tell you you ordered something you didn't.

We went there for breakfast this morning after having done the Princess Christmas festivities last night. The food was good, the service was good and fast despite being busy and Christmas Eve. There was no wait, we got there just in time. The only reason I give 4 stars is that the waitress (who otherwise was fabulous and friendly) kept putting things on the table in front of my toddler within his reach. If you've got little people in your party, you understand. That would be my only feedback.

The first time at this location. Came here after a charity walk that was close by. Service was good, but more than one person including me out of the party of seven said the food was bland.   I had the meat lover skillet which was a good portion but the hash was not cooked long enough to be crispy. The gravy with chicken fried steak had no taste other than salt.   Service was good enough to merit another chance here.

One of my favorite things about living in Scottsdale is all the breakfast options. Does any city love breakfast more than Scottsdale? US Egg is one of many entries on the scene and it is a good one. The best? No, but it is a reliable spot that i can count on. My fav order is the Eggs Benedict. Theis location always seems to be busy and have a vibrant atmosphere.

Not bad! The service was fantastic, and it's a light, airy, nice space to eat a meal in. I enjoyed the ambience and the branding is well done.  The food was pretty good and they give you plenty of it. The waitress was very careful to take note of my nut allergy and check with the kitchen on my order and have it cooked on a separate griddle from where the protein pancakes are cooked (they contain tree nuts). The pancakes were huge and pretty tasty.   Everyone was happy with their food. I think we'd come here again. It's not the most gourmet breakfast in the world but it's good. Coffee was pretty bad, sadly.  I'd like to try a scramble next time. They sounded pretty great.

My favorite breakfast place when I come to Az.  Their omelets are amazing and yesterday I had their protein blueberry  pancakes so very  yummy.   My better half had the chicken fried steak he lived it. Also the bloody marys are bomb they have bacon and pickles.  Service is 5 star! Best breakfast place around

Love US Egg.  One of my favorite restaurants.  No matter how busy they always seem to find a place to sit.  I always get the same thing and I love it.  I order the Santa Fe half and half with protien pancakes.  The quality is great and so is the service.  Its the first place we go when we get to Scottsdale.

We ended up at US Egg only after making several wrong turns en route from the hotel to another breakfast spot.  As usual, my blunder turned into a fantastic surprise.   US Egg served up super fresh food, great decor and very friendly service.  I had the pancakes, eggs and bacon. The pancakes are made with wheat flour, which gave them a deliciously natural flavor and texture.  My meal also included four sizable bacon strips...most places skimp by giving you three thin pieces.  The coffee also hit the spot (before leaving, the waitress offered a go cup).  Another small yet memorable touch.   Too bad we ate at US Egg on the last day of our trip...I would've eaten there every morning!

Excellent place for breakfast! When you walk in the place is one big room. Booths separate the center of the room with tables all around. We were there for late breakfast so it was not crowded at all. Service was quick, attentive and courteous. I was most impressed with the fresh fruit. Most places cut fruit early so some dry out of get slimy. This fruit was none of those thing! It was on the cheap side even though we ate healthy. Great decor inside! Will def come back!

I love this place for breakfast.  Everything I have ever ordered has been good.  I normally stick to my Eggs Benedict (I get the California style w/ avocado and tomato) and call it good.  But here I have tried the breakfast burrito, the whole wheat pancakes, the protein pancakes, the huevos rancheros, the veggie omlette, chocolate chip pancakes, and it was all good!  Yeserday I saw they have a pumpkin pancake, I think I'll wait for the holiday spirit to hit me before I try that one, but I'm sure it will be awsome.  If I had to gripe, I wish they had a bar for mimosa's and Bloody Mary's, but I should probably cut down on my morning drinking anyway.

We came into this location after a bad experience at a different restaurant. We were seated quickly and our server Crystal was awesome. She was very attentive to our toddler and brought him crackers to satisfy him until our food came. Our food was on point as always. We love the protein pancakes! Thank you US Egg for another great breakfast experience.

The most friendly service, beautiful waitresses, and the food was amazing. We were in n out in less then 30 min! Prompt to service. Food was made fast and tasted delicious. I got the hawk-eye egg white omelet and it was very filling! My buddy's got the skillet and they couldn't even finish it! Everything amazing and tasty. WILL come back when i am back in Arizona.
Wonderful service and food. Outdoor seating is tough for them based on the location. Indoor has a wonderful atmosphere.

We have been loyal US Egg fans since we started coming to Spring Training in 2014. Unfortunately, our experience yesterday at this location was one that had us seeking a new breakfast place. Service was great as usual, but all of the food in our party of 5 people was cold. I, personally, didn't say anything because I thought maybe it was just mine. After we left and got to talking, we all said the same thing.....food was cold (not just lukewarm, but cold).  Again, unfortunate because we've always enjoyed coming here and raved (and recommended) it to others.

Mediocre service and sub-par food quality.  I'd rather make my own breakfast than go here.  If you're committed to having someone else scramble your eggs go to a nicer place that focuses more on quality rather than quantity...seriously this place is huge and you won't really enjoy yourself.  I know I didn't.  There are plenty of other places to go in the immediate area...I just really don't think this place is getting into a car and driving for.

Love this place for a quick breakfast. When you are on a timeline, have a large group, and just want a consistent, fast, clean place to eat - this is the spot.  I have been to their location in Old Town Scottsdale many times and am glad that a new location opened in my area.  This location is pretty much the same as the other--same menu, large open dining area, lots of noise and people bustling in and out.  I will admit that the food isn't noteworthy - that's not to say it's bad, just nothing fancy or special.  But the prices are really good! If you are in the mood for something a bit more upscale or alternative, there are plenty of other places... U.S. Egg is more of a classic diner experience.    Side notes: Their staff are always on the ball and pleasant. Also like the other location- parking is a challenge.

It was very crowded for Father's Day!...but that is to be expected and is a positive showing for the business!!  As busy as it was, I was seated within 20 minutes and the service was prompt!...  I wanted to order eggs benedict but I have to confess that I used the photos and comments in YELP to show the waitress that some people complained that the eggs were overcooked...and I soooooooo wanted good-soft-and runny eggs in my benedict....she was right on top of it and it turned out PERFECT!...Yummmmmmmm.  The juice was fresh squeezed O.J. And the coffee was very tasty, not like it was overdone or old...  I give them four stars because there is no readily available bike rack outside....and this was my 1st time here on a holiday...so I need to wait until I come back and see if they are consistent.  PS...Great menu selections too!  Out.
Solid breakfast choice in Scottsdale. Service was good, food was tasty and reasonably priced.
The best place to eat breakfast a have had period. Try the protein pancakes. Great serves too. We go here every time we are in Scottsdale.

Really solid breakfast food, perfect for the morning after a fun night. Hearty fare and fresh ingredients, served efficiently with a smile. Lots of standard choices, prepared well.  From the moment you walk in the door, it's pleasant, efficient service. The place is huge, so I've never had to wait long and it was great whether there were two or six in my party.

My husband and I went to U.S. Egg this morning after reading online that they served gluten-free toast from a gluten-free toaster.  As a celiac sufferer I get excited about little things like being able to eat toast in restaurants!    This place is a gem, and not only for people who have to eat gluten-free.  The interior is clean and bright and cheerful, and the staff could not be more friendly or efficient.  Ashley waited on us and she was a peach!  We both had omelettes, which were fluffy and delicious, with tasty fillings.  I can always tell a good omelette when the cook takes the time to saute and soften the vegetables before filling the omelette.  The hash browns were wonderful and crispy without the slightest bit of grease, and, of course, the toast was great.    I almost forgot to mention, but the coffee was excellent.  All in all, it was a great experience and we will definitely return.

I tried this place per request from my friend. I think I need some new friends. This place is nothing special. The ambiance feels akin to an IHOP and although the portions are large for a reasonable price, the quality is par at best. Our hash browns were undercooked when they arrived at our table and were undercooked when they came back a second time. The omelet was good but not spectacular. I had the chicken bacon avocado omelet and the bacon and or chicken was rubbery at times, This is not a sensation I enjoy when eating eggs. The ceiling was also dripping water on my date which is rarely a fun time. I will say that there are a lot of choices of omelets and our server was extremely sweet and attentive to our table.  Other than that it would be a stretch for me to recommend this place to someone I like.
Great choice of menu, Gluten free toast, fresh Fruit Juice, friendly staff, nice decor, good location....and cheap.  Great place for breakfast !!!!    Will go back

I have never eaten at this location but my 5 star review goes out to the guy who performs with the "US Egg sign" at the corner of Shea & Scottsdale! Very talented young man who knows how to turn & toss the sign with an intense passion and always a smile on his face.  Every time I drive by that intersection and watch him I am very entertained and I always think that if I go out for breakfast or lunch I should go to this US Egg place.
Saw it restaurant wild looking for another one went here instead and had a very very good breakfast the people here were very polite and nice and very helpful
Delicious!  Had the chili omelette, was amazing. So were the potatoes. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

Stopped in while driving through town. The 4 star rating is wrong.... Service was excellent, biscuits and gravy...and toast were good but overall the meal wasn't worth 4 stars. Greasy sausage and the hash browns were dry, powdery, and flavorless.

This is one of my favorite places. They always make my food healthy just like I asked them to do. They're inviting. Right when I walk in they everything they can to get me in right away. Their menu is nice and big and has a lot of options

Jumbo!  Portion sizes on these dishes will fill up your inner hungry-man. This was my first time stopping in as I wanted to grab a 12 lunch. Breakfast is always preferred so I opted for the "New Yorker" Omelet and added a pancake side.  Everything was Ok, but having frozen fruit cover your pancake is always a real buzz kill for me.   The coffee was Ok... nothing to jump about.  Service girls were pleasant and the entire place was clean and bright.

In my one visit here, I wasn't too impressed. My 'omelette' was really a large folded egg batter with the ingredients placed between the fold, rather than mixed-in to the batter. This made it hard to eat, especially since the egg was dry. The steamed spinach on the side was good, until it got cold and soggy. The waitresses were very helpful and attentive  The price was too high, I can go to a better restaurant up Scottsdale road for a better meal at a cheaper price

I was there this past Sunday and was very underwhelmed. We arrived around noon, so I got a bacon cheeseburger, while my family ordered breakfast foods. The waitresses were friendly, but moved as slow as glaciers. My burger was decent enough, and my family enjoyed their food as well. The parking situation was bad, and with the new apartments being erected next door, it looks like US Egg has to share their garage in order to fit customers. Kinda weird, but a nice option to be able to get your car out of the million degree sun, even if you have to walk a bit in return. The biggest complaint came from a stereotypical Californian couple (he was wearing a Giants hat) sitting close to us. Half way through our lunch the guy decided to put on some Rihanna (or other hideous pop music) at full volume on his phone so the whole outdoor patio could hear it. Naturally his ditzy girlfriend had to talk even LOUDER (if that was at all possible) over his teenie bopper music. I even caught the guy dancing a bit and singing along to the music, with his leg literally draped over the armrest on his chair. Class act. No one from the restaurant asked him to turn it off, despite the dirty looks these two were getting from other customers. And in case you're wondering, the guy couldn't sing. He should stick to his day job, whatever that may be.

The "Protein Pancakes" are always a treat, but the "California Eggs Benedict" was just awful today.  The biggest disappointment were the hash browns though.  They tasted like shredded cardboard.  I am tired of going to a restaurant 20 to 30 times and getting such inconsistent results.  Shame on you US Egg!
No fuss breakfast, roomy and spacious. Good service. Coffee, eggs, bacon...

Been to the Egg countless times.  It is consistently good. I must add that my review is based solely on breakfast food as i've never ventured to the lunch side of the menu. I love those protein pancakes and have yet to meet a person who didn't thoroughly enjoy them. Since i am a fan of savory foods at breakfast, lately i get the Half & Half. This way i get 2 good-sized protein pancakes and half of a scramble. The sausage & bacon scramble is good as well as the chicken & avocado scramble. Their breakfast potatoes are yummy, i like mine with syrup! Its great hangover food and you can usually get a table within about 10 minutes. The service is consistently good here and food is out so quick, which is prob why the wait times are low. It does get busy on wknds after 10am, so be prepared for crowds waiting.

Just finished a great breakfast at U.S. Egg. I had the garden omelet and my husband had the protein pancakes. Both were perfectly cooked and taste great. But, the thing that impressed me most about this place was the service. While we were only there about 45 minutes our waitress checked on us about six or seven times. I can't believe I already forgot her name (I think it was Karena). Besides our waitress, the hostess also stopped by the table to make sure we were enjoying our meal. Sure, it wasn't a Saturday or Sunday morning, but I consider that to be exceptional service by any standards.
I came in hangry and definitely got served a great egg sandwich to satisfy my mood...lol. The service was great!
Went here for lunch and ordered the Mushroom Swiss Angus Burger.  Decent.  It came with a salad.  Decent as well.

Wow! This place is Amazing! The omelettes are STUFFED with whatever you order. I was so pleased at how great the service was. Very accommodating and the waitress Sanders she was on top of our order. I'm definitely coming back!

I have been eating here for 15 years and the food is better and better every time. I was so lucky. The restaurant opened up after hours to host my rehearsal dinner for my wedding. They customized menus and even had gluten free selections for me. We really wanted breakfast under the stars and the whole crew made that possible. The food was amazing. The service was impeccable. The care and concern everyone put forth will be treasured. We were so pleased with everything that we returned to the US Egg on Wednesday for breakfast (Tempe Location). No matter what location you are at, you will have a great meal, service and experience. I highly recommend US Egg. You can't go wrong with the protein cakes, skillets, and more. Thanks Gebran for amazing me! We are so fortunate you agreed to do so much for us. May your kindness be returned 10 fold.

We have been going there for almost 10 years now.  It is our number one favorite place for brunch after church on Sundays.  In all the times we have been there we have never been disappointed with the food, and every server we have experienced is always friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable.  You must have a great orientation program.  I also should say, prices are very reasonable.

We have been going to this US Egg location for about 6 years and usually it's the best.  However, today we had one of the worst dining experiences imaginable.  The worst thing about it was the way the management chose to handle it.  Here's a snapshot: --Party of 4:  2 adults + 2 toddlers.  We were shown to our table immediately. --About 15-20 minutes went by without anyone stopping at our table to even address us. --Finally our order was taken - we ordered two kids breakfasts and two standard items off the menu. --35 minutes later our food had still not arrived.  During that time, our server never once stopped by, checked to see if we needed refills, or indicated anything unusual about our order. --My wife walked up to the host stand to check on the status that was followed by no updates. --Still nobody came over to our table until finally our food arrived - 40 minutes after we ordered it (and a full hour after we sat down at the table with two toddlers). --One of our kid's meals was missing - the server never even placed the order to begin with. --Server started making excuses about how busy they were.  However, we regularly go to this locations on Sunday mornings and they are typically far busier - even with a wait to get a table - and we never have to wait that long for our food. --We explained that we come often and that it never takes this long - and she then challenged us by snootily asking "do you ever come on Sundays?"  To which we responded yes - all the time.  Then she became even more argumentative and said "Well, have you come during Spring Training?"  Of course we have.  And we've been there when it's far busier than it was today and it's never taken this long. --Finally, after arguing with us, we just demanded that she go and get our son's meal since it was clearly missing (and you can only imagine how much fun it is to be with a toddler who's been waiting an hour for food only to see that the rest of his family has something to eat but he still has to wait). --Even before our son's food arrived, my wife cut into her pancake only to find a nasty, slimy brown hair on her plate underneath it. --The food runner finally brought our son's food and at that point we pointed out the hair on the other plate.  She took it away and said she'd bring back a fresh one. --At no point did our server ever come back to apologize for the hair in the food, for forgetting one of our four orders, or for taking so long for the order. --Furthermore, our drinks were never even refilled the entire hour+ we were at our table. --In the end, they took both kids meals off the bill which surprised us that they didn't offer more consideration for the hairy pancakes.  At that point we were very frustrated and in disbelief about the whole thing.  When she told us about taking off the kids meals, I commented that I was surprised they still wanted to charge us for anything given the hair and the wait.  She rudely snapped "If you are eating it, you are paying for it."  We finally left, made a comment to the manager at the front that it was a terrible experience, and he just shrugged and said "I heard about it."  Clearly he didn't care.  Honestly, if they had just provided the slightest bit of remorse or expressed even a hint of an apology it would have been different.  However, instead the server and management were aloof and certainly didn't prioritize customer service over their desire to charge us.  Of course, we paid our bill as always.  However, if they had simply apologized and taken off my wife's hairy pancakes I would not have felt compelled to post this Yelp review.

Love going to US Egg for a yummy breakfast during the weekends. Be prepared as you will most likely have a wait of 15 to 20 minutes. There were 3 of us in our party and we waiting maybe 15 minutes and it was about 11am on a Sunday. We got seated inside and our server came over (she was great). I had the Eggs Benedict, my boyfriend had the 1/2 and 1/2 skillet and protein pancakes and our friend had the spinach and mushroom omelet. Everything came out perfectly and without a long wait for food. I have been to several other nearby breakfast spots and no one can seem to poach an egg propertly but not US Egg! They get it right every time!!!

What a great place for breakfast. This is a family owned business with a great business model. Great service, great food, immaculate restaurant. We were in town from Las Vegas and found this place on Yelp. The food was good and plentiful, it came out quickly. They give you a carafe of coffee so you aren't looking for your waitress to refill your cup. In spite of being super busy on a Saturday morning, we had our food in 10 minutes or less. What a surprise. I give them 5 thumbs up

this was our first breakfast hit-up since we moved back, and gotta say it again....the protein pancakes are still da bomb. so lucious, cruchy yet soft, sweet yet salty, healthy but so much syrup...mmmm! go at an off time or you'll be knocking elbows with the elderly.

Stopped in for breakfast and couldn't decide between the corned beef hash or Denver omelette, went with the Dever and wasn't disappointed, food came out hot and fast, lots of ham which was good and a good portion of hash browns. They dropped off a pot of coffee with the meal so never needed to ask for a refill. Waitress was nice and attentive which made for a positive dining experience

We like this place based on their Protein Pancake. Not sure how good it is for you but it taste good! The servers are super friendly. The only knock is the coffee. It's terrible. I can only give it 3 stars. Please switch to Starbucks or another premium brand as I can't drink it.

Good Food, price, and excellent service I took one star off because the restroom was not kept clean and with paper......I understand it was packed but stilll....I did teell the girl up in the counter and she immediately took care of the restroom.....I would come back for sure

The food was delicious,  nice environment and right across from the hotel I was staying at.  The protein pancakes were amazing, never had then you didn't even need syrup. Their skillets ere also yummy the meat lovers one was spectacular.  Wish they were open for dinner I would come again.
Food is amazing but service is mediocre. But it's a great place! Go try it out!! Their skillets are all so good!

US egg is cute, it reminds me of the smaller breakfast diners but it's so big Today, Sunday, it is very busy but there was a 10 min wait... Not long... They put complimentary coffee outside as well as water Inside is very huge and open so it's a little loud but I enjoy it...  Makes it feel more like breakfast  Our server, Whitney, is super nice and knowledgable of the menu I wasn't quite sure of what to get as they have a big menu as well Big place-Big menu, go figure ;) I asked for her recommendations and she was very helpful I ended up getting the decaf coffee  And The chicken fried steak with eggs  Very good portion  The eggs are good, over easy The hash browns are a little dry and plain so I added pepper and ketchup The chicken fried steak has good flavor and the gravy does too  Good first experience
My mom is in town for Christmas and this is her favorite place for breakfast.  She loves the protein pancakes.  Service here is always great, food is fantastic.
I love this place.  I always find something that is healthy and tasty!  The protein pancakes are the best.
Very consistent solid diner food with friendly service.  Owners seem to be on site a lot and treat employees well. Could use a little more originality on menu
Ordered an Iron Skillet- chicken, bacon, avocado and tomatoes served on hash browns. Cones with an English muffin and two eggs any style. VERY good and filling!

Food: 3.5, Service: 3.5, Atmosphere: 4 Cost to worth it rating: 3 (most special breakfast items like benedits or half and half $12) Opentableable: no, kid's menu: yes (with coloring) Return worthiness: sure  Highlights: - Large menu: from omelettes to pancakes, skillets and lunch sandwiches, there a great variety. Portions were large too. - Decor: diner style with cool art pieces. Many egg cartons painted to look like the American flag (also a Pokestop). Also a big US map on one wall with pictures of iconic items from that state.  - Skillets: liked my chicken, chorizo, and green chile one. Loved mixing a sunnyside up egg with the hash browns and proteins. Hub got the insane meat lovers one which had chicken fried steak, sausage, ham, and bacon covered with white gravy. 4 stars  - Eggs benedict: looked a bit sad and hollandaise was borderline neon but taste was on point. 3.5 stars  - Pitcher of water: maybe they're used to dehydrated people in the desert but leaving one for us was greatly appreciated   Midlights: - Protein pancake: they're famous for this yet I didn't quite enjoy the granola nestled in the batter--it isn't as appealing lacking crunch. 3 stars  Lowlights: - Didn't realize they had a variety of mimosas until I saw the tent towards the end of our meal.  Solid casual place I'd come back to.

Food is good, not great, prices reasonable.  Service on the other hand is horrible.  Last time I ate there, the food came out cold and when brought to the attention of the waitperson, who by the way couln't be found for 15 minutes, she gave us the dear in headlights look and said "sorry".  That was it.  Highly suggest this restaurant get back to basics, because it seems to start at the hop.  The manager is just as bad.

Was in town for some spring training games and tired of the crappy hotel breakfast. Looked this place up and boy am I glad I did. Food was excellent. Had an omelette that was amazing.
